Work

I code, create maps and dabble with websites.

I have always been fascinated with code. If I don't know it, I'll find a way to figure it out. There's always more that can be learned. Code can be optimised for efficient processing.

I have created maps for various publications: thesis and articles included. It's one way to showcase cartographic skills whilst being creative.

With various volunteer organizations, I've been fortunate enough to help lower costs by creating websites that are simple and work for the organization. I recently designed the Lethbridge International Film Festival website.

  • Back

About

Hello, I'm Charmaine Bonifacio. I received my Bachelor of Science degree in Geography with a concentration in Geographical Information Science (GIS) at the University of Lethbridge in 2013. I also completed a two-year Cooperative Education as part of my undergraduate degree.

I recently completed my Master of Science degree in Geography under Dr. Stefan Kienzle and his Hydrology/GIS/Modelling lab team at the University of Lethbridge. My research interest focused on modelling the impact of climate change in the Oldman Reservoir Watershed by coupling an agro-hydrological model with regional climate change scenarios. For a copy of my thesis, please check the University of Lethbridge institutional repository.

After emigrating from the Philippines in 2000, I lived in New South Wales, Australia and the Greater Toronto Area along with my family. I currently live in Lethbridge, Alberta where I have been actively involved in various student and community organizations around Lethbridge.
